page.title: 02KILRENNY CHURCH
page.content:
Kilrenny Church has stood on this site for many hundreds of years. A "culdee chapel" was built here in the l2th Century. The monks of Dryburgh owned the Church of Kilrenny and three shops in Anstruther.
James Melville, when he was minister of Kilrenny Church had his manse built in east Anstruther. In the churchyard General Scott of Balcomie is buried. General Scott was a great gambler even in the l8th Century. He is known to have won nearly half a million pounds.
In the centre of the village is the old mansion house of Innergellie which belonged to the Lumsdaine Family.
